avalancheActivity.comment: A hiker triggered a small avalanche in Esjan on the 8th of Jan in a W-facing slope at around 400 m a.s.l. A small avalanche released in Reykjafell in Mosfellsbær on Jan 6th. Avalanches released on the evening of Jan 5th, over Grafningsvegur by Þingvallavatn, in Svínahlíð.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is expected to be rather stable after the thaw and rain.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is expected to be rather stable after the thaw and rain the last days. Prior to the thaw, snowfall in variable directions formed small wind slabs in isolated spots in the mountains and gullies, while most areas had hard-packed, old, stable snow. A few small slabs released, and weak layers observed in snow pits indicated instability.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Sunnan 5-10m/s og dálítil væta í dag. Sunnan 8-15m/s á þriðjudag með rigningu og súld, talverð um tíma eftir hádegi. Sunnan átt og rigning eða súld á miðvikudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack has subsided and strengthened during thaw. Avalanche danger is considered low.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered, relatively thin wind slabs and persistent weak layers were present in the mountains before the thaw that began on Friday, January 10th. Since then, snow has settled in warm weather, becoming more uniform and stronger. Snow gauges indicate that the snow has reached an isothermal state in many areas. In some gullies high in the mountains, layering and weaknesses may still exist, but overall, the snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Breytilegur vindur á þriðjudag, talsverð rigning seinnipartinn en mögulega slydda eða snjókoma í hæstu fjöll. Rigning og allhvöss sunnanátt á miðvikudag. Frystir á fimmtudag, úrkomulítið.

avalancheActivity.comment: A snowmobile triggered an avalanche in Upsadalur west of Dalvik on Thursday January 9th. A natural avalanche fell in Dýjadalur, either on January 9th or 10th.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack has subsided and strengthened during thaw. Unstable wind slabs are still possible at high elevation, especially in north to east facing gullies and depressions.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack settled in the mild weather on Sunday. Higher in the mountains, where the thaw had less impact, unstable wind slabs may still exist, especially in gullies and sheltered areas from the SW winds. In the coming days, mild weather and rain are expected to reach high elevations, likely causing the snow to continue settling, strengthening, and subsiding.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðlægar áttir og dálítil rigning næstu daga, mögulega slydda eða snjókoma hátt til fjalla. Kólnar seinnipart fimmtudags og úrkomulítið eftir það.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small wet avalanche released in Fannardalur the 12th of January.Two avalanches released in Bjólfur on january 7th and one small avalanche above Neskaupstaður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is considered stable after the thaw.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. TThe snowpack is considered stable after the thaw. There is some is in gullies and cliffs, and there has been some ice collapse during the thaw.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Sunnan 8-13m/s og rigning með köflum á þriðjudag og miðvikudag. Áfram hlýtt.
